page.title: 06TRANSPORT IN FELMINGHAM
page.content: Public Transport is poor in this region. The National Bus Service sends out one bus a week, on a Saturday morning. In Felmingham we have a{Community Bus} which runs two mornings a week into North Walsham, and, if you are fairly agile you can make the connection with the train to Norwich. There is no bus service to Aylsham. The local schools are served by special buses. Technically only children between 5 & 8 are entitled to travel to Colby Primary School; but in practise, as there are spare seats, the older children are allowed on. Those over 11 years travel free of charge to Aylsham Secondary School or Paston 6th Form College in North Walsham.
